intro: Caucalis nodosa, commonly known as the nodding caucalis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the familyApiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender stems and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy areas and has a creeping habit with nodding inflorescences. Its leaves are finely divided and often aromatic, while its roots are fibrous and used in traditional herbal medicine. Caucalis nodosa is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in meadows and along stream banks.
